head.supplied: 1/11/93 ¶ ¶ You shall have every encouragement in your study of the native plants, dear Mr Williamson, and they will much contribute to genuine and lasting pleasures of your life. ¶ The label was me...

div.p: Box 1791/15, Williamson Papers, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

You shall have every encouragement in your study of the native plants, dear Mr Williamson, and they will much contribute to genuine and lasting pleasures of your life.
See M to H. Williamson, 31 August 1893.
The label was merely sent to show you, how any specimens from you will be treated here.
Please look carefully on all floating and submerged weeds of your locality, as aquatic plants received less attention than land plants in Victorian searches.
